DataElement.preferredName: Circumferential Surgical Margin Resection Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text response that indicates the margin type that has been involved by invasive carcinoma that has not been previously listed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to circumferential surgical margins and resection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
